section.p: This section provides a quick reference to the block storage requirements of delegate hosts. These requirements are in addition to the storage required for the operating system. For more information, refer to the .

Each delegate host in a cluster requires one local, unformatted, high-performance device or partition with 50GB of storage. A step in this chapter configures the space as a device mapper thin pool for Docker data.

Two of the delegate hosts in a cluster require an additional local, unused, high-performance device or partition with 50GB of storage. These two hosts are configured to serve as nodes in a ZooKeeper ensemble, and must be located on the same subnet as the master host. A procedure in this chapter formats the storage as an XFS file system, which is mounted for use by internal services.
